CatDescriptText: David Early, postal worker, East Liberty, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 24, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think that President-elect Kennedy was sincere in offering Congressman William Dawson, of Chicago, the cabinet position of Postmaster-General?" Answer reads: "I believe he was sincere in offering the appointment.  I felt that Dawson was the right man for the job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of David Early wearing moustache, hat, and zippered jacket with pockets, standing in front of store window
